title: cannot compile kiln branch on windows.
body:

# üêû Bug Report

### Description

I am trying to compile Kiln branch on Windows but it fails everytime

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> dk what to say

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
git clone -b kiln https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm.git
cd prysm
bazel build  //cmd/beacon-chain:beacon-chain

## üî• Error
 Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it...

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:**

Windows 11

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

kiln-branch

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

> @galaxy4627 Try without the release flag. Also make sure you have the `patch` tool installed.
> 
> This link may be helpful for installing `patch` on your machine: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/patch.htm I'm not a windows user so you may have to do some searching of your own.

issue still occurs, tried with bazel build  //cmd/beacon-chain:beacon-chain and I did install patch

> CreateProcessW("bash" -c "patch '-p1' < C:/users/e/prysm/third_party/com_github_ethereum_go_ethereum_secp256k1.patch"): The system cannot find the file specified.

Is this right? It tries to run bash on windows? I thought we never supported compiling on windows and only cross compiled for it

> > CreateProcessW("bash" -c "patch '-p1' < C:/users/e/prysm/third_party/com_github_ethereum_go_ethereum_secp256k1.patch"): The system cannot find the file specified.
> 
> Is this right? It tries to run bash on windows? I thought we never supported compiling on windows and only cross compiled for it

so, is there nothing i can do to run a kiln prysm node on windows?
@galaxy4627 You can compile it via `go` instead of bazel if you just want to test kiln. We should be having a release soon through which you can run it directly via our binaries/image.

> @galaxy4627 You can compile it via `go` instead of bazel if you just want to test kiln. We should be having a release soon through which you can run it directly via our binaries/image.

how would i compile prysm via go?

> how would i compile prysm via go?

`go run ./cmd/beacon-chain/... --flag1 --flag2`

This is how it would work
`kiln` branch has been closed. All its functionality is merged into the `develop` branch. Please try that and feel free to reopen the issue is persists
